user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_dir_seek:
```c
int lfs_dir_seek(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir, lfs_off_t off) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_seek(%p, %p, %"PRIu32")",
            (void*)lfs, (void*)dir, off);

    err = lfs_dir_seek_(lfs, dir, off);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_seek -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_dir_seek:
static int lfs_dir_seek_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir, lfs_off_t off) {
    // simply walk from head dir
    int err = lfs_dir_rewind_(lfs, dir);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    // first two for ./..
    dir->pos = lfs_min(2, off);
    off -= dir->pos;

    // skip superblock entry
    dir->id = (off > 0 && lfs_pair_cmp(dir->head, lfs->root) == 0);

    while (off > 0) {
        if (dir->id == dir->m.count) {
            if (!dir->m.split) {
                return LFS_ERR_INVAL;
            }

            err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &dir->m, dir->m.tail);
            if (err) {
                return err;
            }

            dir->id = 0;
        }

        int diff = lfs_min(dir->m.count - dir->id, off);
        dir->id += diff;
        dir->pos += diff;
        off -= diff;
    }

    return 0;
}
...
static int lfs_dir_rewind_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir) {
    // reload the head dir
    int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &dir->m, dir->head);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    dir->id = 0;
    dir->pos = 0;
    return 0;
}
...
static inline int lfs_pair_cmp(
        const lfs_block_t paira[2],
        const lfs_block_t pairb[2]) {
    return !(paira[0] == pairb[0] || paira[1] == pairb[1] ||
             paira[0] == pairb[1] || paira[1] == pairb[0]);
}
...
static int lfs_dir_fetch(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_mdir_t *dir, const lfs_block_t pair[2]) {
    // note, mask=-1, tag=-1 can never match a tag since this
    // pattern has the invalid bit set
    return (int)lfs_dir_fetchmatch(lfs, dir, pair,
            (lfs_tag_t)-1, (lfs_tag_t)-1, NULL, NULL, NULL);
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
static int lfs_dir_seek_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir, lfs_off_t off) {
    // simply walk from head dir
    int err = lfs_dir_rewind_(lfs, dir);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    // first two for ./..
    dir->pos = lfs_min(2, off);
    off -= dir->pos;

    // skip superblock entry
    dir->id = (off > 0 && lfs_pair_cmp(dir->head, lfs->root) == 0);

    while (off > 0) {
        if (dir->id == dir->m.count) {
            if (!dir->m.split) {
                return LFS_ERR_INVAL;
            }

            err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &dir->m, dir->m.tail);
            if (err) {
                return err;
            }

            dir->id = 0;
        }

        int diff = lfs_min(dir->m.count - dir->id, off);
        dir->id += diff;
        dir->pos += diff;
        off -= diff;
    }

    return 0;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: lfs_dir_seek_ calls lfs_dir_rewind_, lfs_pair_cmp, lfs_dir_fetch and lfs_min (and lfs_dir_fetch calls lfs_dir_fetchmatch). None of these call lfs_dir_seek_ (or lfs_dir_seek_) back, so there is no direct or indirect recursion in the shown call chain.
